items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

1. Position Management
	 
a. Revised Job Description
	 
Police Officer I
	 
Education and Experience
	 
Current language:
	 
The position requires a high school diploma or equivalent supplemented by specialized, successful training in law enforcement by a recognized academy.
	 
New language:
	 
1. Have a U.S. high school diploma, GED certificate, or high school equivalency certificate, or a two-year, four-year, or advanced degree from an accredited or approve college/(per California Government Code 1031 (e) AND
	 
2. Completion of at least a 884-hours California P.O.S.T. Certified Basic Law Enforcement Academy within the past three (3) years AND 2500 work hours with a P.O.S.T. accredited public safety agency which included verifiable field training, OR 
	 
3. Possession of a valid California P.O.S.T. Basic Certificate.
	 
	 
Licenses and Certificates
	 
Requires a valid California Driver's License. Requires possession of a P.O.S.T. Basic Certificate. Requires current First Aid and CPR cards within a reasonable time after employment.

items.item_details:
On July 9, 2013 the Board agreed to enter into a contract with JKL Construction Services, Inc. to provide construction services to upgrade and extend underground utilities including power, telecommunications, gas, heating and cooling water to buildings on campus.
	 
Construction contracts often times experience unforeseen conditions, coordination gaps and/or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  During excavation several unforeseen conditions and unmarked utilities were encountered which required revisions to the design drawings.  In addition, the contractor uncovered existing utilities that were leaking and required repair.  JKL has submitted change proposals, which were reviewed for accuracy and conformance with the Contract Documents.
	 
Original Contract Amount             $2,880,567
Previous Approved Changes       $     23,646
Change Order No. 003                 $       8,282
	 
Total Contract and Changes        $2,912,495
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 003 for JKL Construction Services Inc. in the amount of $8,282 for the San Jose City College Utility Extension Project.

items.item_details:
On October 9, 2012, the Board approved a Project Authorization Amendment #02 to LPAS, Inc. for professional services for Design Development Phase documents for the Physical Education/Gym Project #122.
	 
This Revision 02 modifies the Scope of Services only and will be funded by unused monies in the current agreement.  There are no additional costs required due to this revision.
	 
The Design Professional has been tasked with reviewing and re-validating the present needs of the Athletics department at San Jose City College and to conduct Value Engineering to revise the design to meet the current budget of approximately $16,500,000 which, in large part, may be achieved by utilizing existing facilities in addition to new construction.  A new agreement will be presented to the Board in the New Year to complete the construction document phase of the project.

items.item_details:
Title 5, Section 51010 requires that the governing board of a community college district shall:           (a) adopt a district policy which describes its equal employment opportunity program and meets the requirements of section 53002; (b) develop and adopt a district equal employment opportunity plan which meets the requirements of section 53003; (c) annually review the composition of the employee workforce in the manner required by section 53004; (d) ensure that a program of recruitment is carried out as required by section 53021; (e) ensure that screening and selection procedures are developed and used in accordance with section 53024; (f) ensure that, where necessary, additional steps are taken consistent with the requirements of section 53006; (g) ensure that the pattern of hiring and retention, when viewed over time, is consistent with the objectives established in the district's equal employment opportunity plan; and (h) substantially comply with the other provisions of subchapter 1 (commencing with section 53000) of chapter 4.
	 
Title 5, Section 53003 states that the governing board of each community college district shall submit the district-wide written equal employment opportunity plan in accordance with the requirements of Section 53003 to the Chancellor's Office. The Chancellor’s Office retains the authority to review district plans on a case-by-case basis.  Each district shall review its EEO Plan at least once every three years and revise as determined necessary.  Any revised EEO Plan shall be submitted to the Chancellor’s Office, which retains the authority to review such revisions on a case-by-case basis.  
	 
Title 5, Section 53024.1 requires each district to develop and maintain institutional commitment to diversity.  Establishing and maintaining a richly diverse workforce is an on-going process that requires continued institutionalized effort. Districts shall locally develop, and implement on a continuing basis, indicators of institutional commitment to diversity. 
	 
The San José-Evergreen Community College District’s Equal Employment Opportunity & Diversity Advisory Committee has devoted countless number of hours to the development of this EEO & Diversity Plan over the past few years.  Acknowledgement and appreciation for these special efforts go to all who have been instrumental in providing support for the development of this Plan, and in particular to the District EEO & Diversity Advisory Committee members who were appointed by their constituency groups, including:  Barbara Hanfling (Faculty Association), Clem Lundie (SJCC Academic Senate), Marjorie Clark (EVC Academic Senate – until summer 2013), Adrienne Burns (EVC CSEA), Joe Lugo, Jr. (SJCC CSEA), Vince Oen* (DO CSEA), Charles Stevens* (SJCC Associated Student Government), Dr. Elaine Burns (MSC SJCC), Sam Ho (Co-Chair/MSC DO – Chancellor-appointed), Victoria Lugo* (MSC EVC), and Arturo Ocampo* (Co-Chair/MSC DO – Chancellor-appointed).  (*Those who are denoted with asterisks have left District’s employment).  The drafts of the Plan were distributed to District Council on 12.20.2012 (narrative), 4.18.2013 (attachments), 10.17.2013, and 11.21.2013.  At the 11.21.2013 meeting, District Council approved the attached Plan Draft.  
	 
The San José-Evergreen Community College District’s Equal Employment Opportunity & Diversity Advisory Committee would like to express appreciation to the Chancellor, the Chancellor’s Executive Team, the District Council representing Constituency Groups for Faculty, Classified, Management/Supervisory/Confidential, and Students for your time and efforts in the review, recommendation, and support for this EEO & Diversity Plan. 
	 
The San José-Evergreen Community College District’s Equal Employment Opportunity & Diversity Advisory Committee would like to also thank Chancellor Dr. Rita Cepeda for her leadership and guidance in the development of this Plan, and for presenting this Plan to the Board of Trustees.
	 
Attached is the final draft of the SJECCD EEO & Diversity Plan presented for first reading, with expected action at the next meeting of the Board.
